title: Crash when importing torch after creating QApplication
body_html:
Issue description

pytorch and PyQt seem to clash. If I import torch after creating a QApplication object, python will crash.

Code example

from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication

# will not crash if torch is imported here:
# import torch

a = QApplication([])

import torch

the output would be:

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error'
  what():  expected ) but found 'ident' here:
aten::_addmv(Tensor self, Tensor mat, Tensor vec, *, Scalar beta=1, Scalar alpha=1) -> Tensor
                                                                    ~~~~~~ <--- HERE

System Info

Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: None

OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.3.0-16ubuntu3) 7.3.0
CMake version: version 3.12.1

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: No CUDA
GPU models and configuration: No CUDA
Nvidia driver version: No CUDA
cuDNN version: No CUDA

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] Could not collect
[conda] pytorch-cpu               0.4.1                py36_cpu_1    pytorch
[conda] torchvision-cpu           0.2.1                    py36_1    pytorch

I created the conda environment via

conda create -n pytorch-qt -c pytorch -c conda-forge pytorch-cpu torchvision-cpu pyqt

Thank you in advance for any help and of course for this wonderful library of yours!

body:
## Issue description

`pytorch` and `PyQt` seem to clash. If I import torch after creating a `QApplication` object, python will crash.

## Code example

```python
from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication

# will not crash if torch is imported here:
# import torch

a = QApplication([])

import torch
```

the output would be:

```
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error'
  what():  expected ) but found 'ident' here:
aten::_addmv(Tensor self, Tensor mat, Tensor vec, *, Scalar beta=1, Scalar alpha=1) -> Tensor
                                                                    ~~~~~~ <--- HERE
```

## System Info

```
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: None

OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
GCC version: (Ubuntu 7.3.0-16ubuntu3) 7.3.0
CMake version: version 3.12.1

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: No CUDA
GPU models and configuration: No CUDA
Nvidia driver version: No CUDA
cuDNN version: No CUDA

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] Could not collect
[conda] pytorch-cpu               0.4.1                py36_cpu_1    pytorch
[conda] torchvision-cpu           0.2.1                    py36_1    pytorch

```

I created the conda environment via

```bash
conda create -n pytorch-qt -c pytorch -c conda-forge pytorch-cpu torchvision-cpu pyqt
```

Thank you in advance for any help and of course for this wonderful library of yours!
